On Feb 6, 2006, at 10:35 PM, Kent Beck wrote:

> Joe,
>
> When I was looking at lots of Smalltalk code that used Pluggable  
> Selector
> the consequence I found most annoying was that I could not delete
> seemingly-unreferenced methods because they might be invoked  
> dynamically.

Interestingly, I ran across this just yesterday in some Java code  
that was being called by some Ruby code via a bridge.  This type of  
scenario is very common in application integration.  In my case, a  
Java method was changed from public to private, breaking the Ruby  
code that was calling it.  Fortunately, our automated integration  
tests caught it.

>
> Kent Beck
> Three Rivers Institute
>

--
Daryl
